verbs.description: disconfirm (third-person singular simple present disconfirms, present participle disconfirming, simple past and past participle disconfirmed)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To establish the falsity of a claim or belief; to show or to tend to show that a theory or hypothesis is not valid.
examples: The empirical data obtained in a test—or, as we shall prefer to say, the observation sentences describing those data—may then either confirm or disconfirm the given hypothesis, or they may be neutral with respect to it.
